programme.title: Bloomberg Next Africa
programme.desc: A monthly deep dive into Africa's biggest stories through a Bloomberg lens. programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Kill Em With a Smile
programme.desc: A dying woman finds that the only thing that scares her more than her own death is her husband finding a new person to spend his days with.

programme.title: Knee Deep
programme.desc: A nerdy girl gets deep into street life and becomes a cold force to be reckoned with.

programme.title: Hidden Secrets
programme.desc: Tensions escalate when nine friends reunite at the funeral of a hometown hero.

programme.title: Dangerous Thirst
programme.desc: In an attempt to spice up their marriage, a young couple steps into the sultry world of swinging, but their journey comes at a price.

programme.title: Don't Ever Get Married
programme.desc: Jay, a cynical womanizer, bets his friend he can make his fiancée cheat before their wedding. Confident in his charm, he sets out to seduce her, unaware of the emotional turmoil he'll cause. As his plan spirals, Jay faces the consequences of his actions and the possibility of redemption.

programme.title: Shadows of Redemption
programme.desc: Ares, a ruthless criminal, seeks to reclaim his family's underworld empire. Betrayal and deception haunt his path as he battles former allies and lovers. Determined to avenge his father's murder and reunite his family, Ares faces his toughest challenge yet: uncovering the truth behind the chaos.

programme.title: The Jealous Son
programme.desc: A woman falls for her boyfriend's charismatic son, and soon finds herself entangled in a dangerous obsession.

programme.title: Street Dreams: Los Angeles
programme.desc: An undercover cop with the LAPD stumbles upon a domestic terrorism case that could land him a position in the FBI’s counterintelligence division.

programme.title: Sudden Passion
programme.desc: After reconciling, Ashley and her husband Timothy decide moving to a new town will help them get over infidelity in their marriage. Everything seems to be going great until Ashley gets a job and begins a new affair with her boss.

programme.title: Sisterhood
programme.desc: When a Kiwi woman shows up at her London flat claiming to be her half-sister, Catherine agrees to help stop their dad from stealing their inheritances.

programme.title: Queen Pin
programme.desc: When her boyfriend is killed, a woman quickly builds a team to take over his drug business, attracting dangerous local rivals along the way.

programme.title: Roseland
programme.desc: The residents of Roseland try to convince wild-child Juju to slow down and change his reckless ways.

programme.title: Killer Baby Mama
programme.desc: Calvin and Erica's tumultuous relationship takes a turn when Erica discovers she's pregnant. Unhappy with the news, Calvin decides to break up with her, moving on to date Candace. Meanwhile, Erica befriends Calvin's sick mother to gather information.

programme.title: In This House
programme.desc: Claudia, a medical student, is focused on building a perfect life with her live-in boyfriend Dr. Jayson. Her grandfather's death forces her to go back to her hometown to face her estranged family and her past. Once she arrives, she uncovers sinister secrets and will stop at nothing to break the generational curse stemming from her family's history.

programme.title: It Is What It Is
programme.desc: Victoria, a sophisticated young woman, is trying to find happiness with a good man in the midst of drugs and violence in the mean streets of KC.

programme.title: Toxic Traits
programme.desc: Eric is a prodigal son, who meets Regina on a dating app and they fall in love. The two seem like a match made in heaven, except for Eric's suspicious mother. Events begin to unfold and Regina's true nature comes to light.

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: Lost and grieving, Chris seeks solace in the wrong crowd. A chance encounter with the enigmatic Patrick leads him down a dangerous path, forcing him to confront his own morality and the consequences of his choices.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Outlaws murder Father Holzer when he takes in a youngster.

programme.title: Tombstone

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: To keep his invalid mother happy, an outlaw forces Lucas and Mark to go along with a masquerade that he is the owner of Lucas's ranch.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A sharecropper enters his colt in a horse race hoping to win enough money to buy his farm from the owner who has bet on Mark McCain's entry.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Lucas hires an ex-con as a ranch hand, the man is the first one under suspicion when a robbery and murder occur in the area.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas helps his former Army captain, now an undercover federal agent, infiltrate a gang of bank robbers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas finds himself involved in murder when he gallantly steps to the aid of a beautiful woman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An ex-convict is blamed for a brutal crime despite his claims of rehabilitation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is out for vengeance when Mark is used as a pawn in a bank robbery scheme.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas shoots a horse thief who turns out to be a member of the Boyle clan. Now Ma Boyle is after him.

programme.title: The Great Locomotive Chase
programme.desc: It's the Civil War, and Union spy James J. Andrews (Fess Parker) is on a top-secret mission: to steal a Confederate train outside of Atlanta and take it back to Union territory in Tennessee, using it to sabotage and destroy Confederate supply routes along the way. But the train's conductor (Jeffrey Hunter) is on to Andrews and is determined to try his best to throw a wrench in the Union spy's plans before he delivers the train to his fellow soldiers.

programme.title: Westward Ho the Wagons!
programme.desc: Based on Mary Jane Carr's novel of the perils and hardships endured by pioneers traversing the Oregon Trail.

programme.title: Across the Wide Missouri
programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. Determined to stay on the good side of the local Blackfoot tribe, Flint is intent on marrying Kamiah (Maria Elena Marques), the beautiful daughter of Ironshirt (Ricardo Montalban) -- especially since this union would allow him to freely pursue his trade in the region. Struggling to win the approval of the protective Ironshirt, Flint finds himself truly falling for Kamiah.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene and Pat risk disgrace and death in a desperate attempt to convince a boy that there is nothing heroic about the life of an outlaw.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene and his pal Pat help a wounded rancher and learn that the man's son-in-law is suspected of the shooting.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: ene helps a thirteen-year-old Eastern boy who has traveled west in search of his father, a man he does not know is actually an outlaw.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: While in search of a masked gang, Gene and Pat find a dying rancher. The two cowboys find themselves in danger when they try to carry out the rancher's oral will.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: When Gene befriends a young boy and a mistreated palomino, his kindness is repaid in an unexpected way while on the trail of bank robbers.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene sets out to capture his friend's killer, but when Sheriff Davis unwillingly cooperates in the search, Gene begins to suspect the lawman of being in cahoots with the outlaw.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene protects a young boy's wild horse accused of killing an old prospector. Though evidence indicates that the horse is at fault, Gene sets out to find the real killer.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene helps a rainmaker and several honest ranchers drive out land-swindlers and a drought.

programme.title: The White Buffalo
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and Crazy Horse, two legendary figures, head out on a quest for the demon albino buffalo in this haunting western tale.

programme.title: The Savage
programme.desc: A wagon train moves across the plains, only to be attacked by lawless Native American raiders. While attempting to rid the plains of raiders, Sioux Chief Yellow Eagle (Ian MacDonald) and his warriors discover the scene of the massacre. They adopt the sole survivor, a young boy, and rename him Warbonnet. Years later, the adult Warbonnet (Charlton Heston) is in a tough spot when a war erupts between the Sioux and the settlers, prompting the adopted pioneer to question his allegiances.

programme.title: Three Violent People
programme.desc: A rancher (Charlton Heston), his shady bride (Anne Baxter) and his one-armed brother (Tom Tryon) fight amid carpetbaggers in Texas.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.desc: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight's program sees Gordon Ramsay in Oscars in Nantwich. On the surface this place seems idyllic, an Irish family run restaurant in the heart of beautiful countryside. Owner MAURA runs the front of house and her son LENIN is the Head chef, but it's not "happy families". With her life savings on the line Maura is in big trouble. She constantly bickers with her son whilst the customers are forced to wait hours for their fluorescent crab stick paellas, and stodgy carbonaras from Oscars "bit of everything" menu.

programme.title: Next Level Chef (UK)
programme.desc: There’s a Next Level Chef bombshell with the reveal that the team competition is over! It’s now every chef for themselves. And the 8 remaining cooks must tackle Seafood Week.

programme.title: Next Level Chef (UK)
programme.desc: Tonight in the Next Level Chef kitchen the 7 remaining chefs take on Fusion cooking, for a place in the Semi Final. There is a surprise visit from king of fusion himself, Big Zuu!

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
In tonight's final programme Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater in Brighton where he oversaw one of the most spectacular changes of fortune at a single venue. Owner CHARITA JONES was producing a menu of irresistible unique classics from the Deep South, but at the same facing financial disaster. The punters were missing, and so was her business acumen. But Gordon succeeded in shutting her out of the kitchen, getting the chef back on the boil and putting the soul back into the business.
Today Charita is fully-booked round the clock and bursting out of the Soul Shack to take on the 110-seater Momma Cherri's Big House. But expansion brings a different set of challenges, and she's still struggling to control her staff and manage her success. Has she got what it takes to make the next step up, or will she be forced to rethink her grand plans?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's penultimate programme Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasted top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff, all of them on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of the haggis. But the locals weren't biting and the restaurant was empty most nights. Gordon's recipe for survival forced them to tone down their act and demystify the menu to get the punters in. Today the restaurant's return to form has led to plans for expansion. Loic is still there, and now he's been promoted to Executive Chef he will oversee any new ventures. But can he continue to resist a return to French frills, and has he managed to pull off his own personal ambition, a Michelin star?

programme.title: Next Level Chef (UK)
programme.desc: It’s the Semi Final of Next Level Chef. 6 chefs are battling for a place in the Final, only 3 can make it. They must all produce one incredible ‘Best of British’ dish to get there.

programme.title: Next Level Chef (UK)
programme.desc: It’s the Final of Next Level Chef! The three remaining chefs must all cook a 3-course meal in just 90 minutes, with one of them winning the £100k prize, plus the amazing mentorship.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highlights from the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet a group of volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden, and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A special programme from the first big flower show of the season, the RHS Malvern Spring Festival. Rachel de Thame and Nick Bailey explore show gardens packed full of ideas and discover the newest varieties of plants and flowers that are hot off the potting bench. There are the herb specialists from Gloucestershire who believe that edibles are just as important as ornamentals in the garden, and a nursery famed for its foxgloves that also has an impressive collection of tree peonies.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is busy planting out tropical gingers and sweetcorn and direct sowing beans. Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, and Rekha Mistry shares the secrets of growing aubergines.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty creates colourful planting schemes with trailing plants. He also plants out cabbages in the vegetable garden and shares a clever tip for dealing with spent tulips. Toby Buckland revels in the displays of roses at Mount Ephraim Gardens in Kent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring Ramona Jones, who was diagnosed with autism in her twenties and discovered how she can find her true identity when she's in the garden. Meanwhile, Monty makes some changes to his pots in the Jewel Garden, harvests gooseberries and plants out squash.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are Birmingham-bound for the annual Gardeners' World Live event. Monty Don, Arit Anderson, Adam Frost, Sue Kent, Carol Klein, Joe Swift, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill present the best the gardening world has to offer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lifetime collection of cars leaves Tom speechless

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Marines combat correspondent Ken Plant tells of being captured and tortured as a POW.

programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Sheila Mitchell-Murphy honors the memory her Son…American hero Etienne Murphy.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Déjà vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90’s, Arden doesn’t let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest in New Zealand going after the Wingshooting Slam. On the first two days of the hunt, he was able to cross off the turkey, quail, and peacock on his list. It's now opening day of waterfowl and Mark will be spending the day on a small pond close to the coast. With the limit being 50 birds per person, Mark plans to put the Benelli shotgun to work and cross a few more birds off his Wingshooting Slam.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The last hunt in this series takes us to Texas in February of 2017. This time Mark is after his first Aoudad with a muzzleloader. Aoudad were introduced to Texas as an exotic species and it didn't take long for them to establish a large viable population in the ideal habitat that West Texas offers. Going into this hunt with the confidence and extended range that only Gunwerks can provide, Mark knows the odds are in his favor and it doesn't take long to come across multiple bands of rams. Thanks for following along in this 3 part series as we looked back on some of Mark's most memorable hunts for these incredible animals found all over the world. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!
Kris and Flint Seymour hunt down a Kansas giant!

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: The Hunted Land & Sea is in Montana hunting for whitetail deer with Harris Hunts. Kristian Hansen and Gerry Holland have tags and Kim Hansen is tagging along for the hunt. Part One.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: The Huntsman
programme.desc: Ask any mature hunter and you'll hear the same answer: the joy you feel when you witness your friend having successfully hunted an animal is far greater than the joy you would have felt had you been the one to pull the trigger. The reason for this selflessness goes deep into the roots of what drives hunters to hunt.In this episode of The Huntsman Chris and KC are back for another Australian hunting adventure. Continuing off the back of their successful camel hunt it's KC's turn to fill the freezer and he's got his sights set on both wild goat and rusa deer. In these moments, the joy comes from knowing you've played a part in someone else's achievement. It's a selfless joy that resonates deeper and lasts longer. This is what makes hunting more than just a sport—it's a way of life that fosters respect, gratitude, and an enduring sense of community.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: Full Strut
programme.desc: After Shawn filled his Missouri tag, it was Rex & Chandler's turn to attempt at harvesting their birds! Chandler is yet to kill an Eastern Gobbler so we are definitely going to give it our all to try and accomplish this for him. Both Rex & Chandler have many hunts and some incredible encounters. One of which ended in a way we never would have expected.... The gobbler jukes an arrow while being only 10 yards away!? Can we seal the deal after the miss?? Watch to see!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it’s no different. With Winchester’s in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt and Mark Kayser demonstrate the strategic use of terrain and natural cover to outsmart big whitetails. Then Mark heads to fill his tag in the rugged landscapes of South Dakota.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Heroes are honored and embark on the hunt of a lifetime at the Bucks for the Brave event hosted by Record Rack and Trinity Oaks Non-Profit.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: We explore the sophisticated world of the whitetail deer's senses, exploring how these remarkable creatures have evolved to pattern hunters through their keen sense of smell and heightened sensory awareness.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run west from Hawks Cay to fish the spring tarpon migration at the legendary Bahia Honda bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head down to Key West to join Captain Brandon Cyr for some skinny water bonefishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor fish the Lower Keys with Captain Brandon Cyr for baby tarpon in the mangroves.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Today we’re having a conversation with Zeb Hogan, the author, biologist, and television host known for his show "Monster Fish." In this episode, Hogan shares his experiences with the show, his upcoming book "Chasing Giants: In Search of the World's Largest Freshwater Fish," and his insights into the world of freshwater biology. Hogan's show "Monster Fish" takes viewers on a journey around the globe to explore the largest and most elusive freshwater fish in the world. programme.desc: In this episode Capt. Mike Anderson is fishing in Venice Louisiana with tournament angler Capt. Ryan Rickard.

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Finally, the 2021 turkey season is here. The earliest turkey that is legal to hunt is in South Florida, and that's where Phillip Culpepper and the guys are headed. Things get up close and personal on the first morning of the season.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In this episode of Goin' Coastal, Captain Josh and Anna Calhoon set out for some fun Flounder fishing. They enjoy a delicious hook & cook served up fresh from their day at AJ's!

programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins Capt. KC Spaulding on a quest to catch a slam in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Clay "Flounder" Guest & Texan Cliff Wright host Capt. Jared Raskob on a charity redfish event the "Borracho Pescador" in Texas.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA’s skiff gets an upgrade. Now no fish is safe.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: Ca Fishes in his home waters for probably the most powerful inshore fish, the gag grouper.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny joins True North Trout and Koz as they hit the Manistee River for a bit of trout fishing on the fly.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: *Part 2* Zach and Carson Wentz hunt the early season in Kentucky hoping to catch up with velvet bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: The guys at Slade Northwest head to Western Washington.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons goes on a Lionfish Hunt that takes him to some of the most beautiful reefs in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a family filled episode as Brandon Simmons goes offshore with his Cousin to find Cobia and Tuna while also bringing his family to his childhood home

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon gets back to his roots and explores the waterways around Cape Canaveral in his Pelican Kayak with his old Fishing buddy, Tyler Hendrix

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip back to Southwest Florida to chase after Redfish and Snook. Plus, a special tour of the Costa Custom Boat Factory

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Richard Black & Capt. Randy fish Biscayne Bay.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, we are cruising the islands of the Caribbean on board a luxury super yacht. From Antigua to Martinique, St Lucia to the Grenadines, it’s a picture perfect paradise.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

Hogan's show "Monster Fish" takes viewers on a journey around the globe to explore the largest and most elusive freshwater fish in the world. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
programme.desc: In postwar Honolulu, a former sex worker finds herself courted by a love-struck Marine as a religious zealot sets his sights on reforming her.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball
programme.desc: A group of enlisted men, led by Private Hogan, are tasked with planning a dance party, while trying to keep it a secret from a busy-body officer.

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: Hoedown
programme.desc: An ex-movie cowboy (Jack O'Mahoney) and a newswoman (Jeff Donnell) rope bank robbers at a singer's (Eddy Arnold) dude ranch.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Pecos River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) catch mail robbers.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: Desert Vigilante
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) bags Mexican-border silver smugglers for Uncle Sam.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: North From the Lone Star
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) puts on a badge to clean up a town.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: The Date Whisperer

programme.desc: A dancer and a boxer must team up for a big performance after a last minute drop out.

programme.title: Love on Your Doorstep
programme.desc: A TV host profiles a local florist’s long-running flower competition in order to land her own show.

programme.title: Romantic Friction

programme.title: Love Marks the Spot
programme.desc: Ghostwriter Becca unexpectedly ends up on the trail from a legendary novel with action star Lee.

programme.title: The Love Gala
programme.desc: Tasked with planning her mom's gala, a woman contends with the venue’s difficult manager and simultaneously navigates multiple romantic interests.

programme.title: Storm Cell
programme.desc: Storm chaser April, whose parents died in a twister during her childhood, must warn her brother and his town of a massive storm heading their way.

programme.desc: An executive assistant on a podcast looks to save her boss's career while dealing with her arising feelings for the journalist who can help revive it.

programme.desc: Paris-trained perfumer Rosalie is forced to share her new store space with furniture maker Jason.

programme.desc: Detective Chen, working undercover, is paired with by-the-book partner, to take on the Triad gang.

programme.desc: After an elusive terrorist with a personal vendetta against Hannah resurfaces, she and her family are placed in protective custody while the team searches for the suspect.

programme.desc: The team identifies the remains of a competitive-eating champion just days before a contest; a brilliant new squint has trouble fitting in; Booth and Brennan try to put themselves in each other's places after a disagreement about the baby.

programme.desc: Booth and Sweets are given access to a toy company's headquarters after an executive's remains are found packaged with a Prince Charming doll; Sweets prepares for his gun certification test; Brennan worries about motherhood.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After dismembered remains are found in multiple mailing boxes, the team uncovers a complicated love triangle; Booth's grandfather reveals surprising news; Special Agent Genny Shaw (Tina Majorino) learns how important teamwork is.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team suspects murder when a storm chaser is killed while filming a tornado; Booth becomes increasingly protective of Brennan.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After a cryptic message written in human blood is found at a national monument, the team ends up embarking on a scavenger hunt; Brennan and Booth search for their perfect family home.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the remains of an escaped convict are found in the sewer, the investigation reveals the man died in prison; Brennan gives birth in unconventional circumstances.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When an extreme couponer's remains are found on the side of a road, the investigation leads the team to the supermarket where she shopped; Brennan adjusts to being at work and away from her baby; Cam is unhappy with her daughter's choice of suitors.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A corpse that has been dyed blue is found in a landfill; when Bones feels uncomfortable in her post-baby body, Booth tries to boost her self-confidence.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and Brennan investigate the death of a truck company employee whose body is found in the woods; Hodgins buys new lab equipment; Brennan worries about Parker's return from England.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a corpse is discovered in the woods, the team considers two families involved in a nearly century-long feud; Brennan is apprehensive when her father (Ryan O'Neal) offers to baby-sit for her daughter.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While in Los Angeles to consult on a film based on her latest book, Brennan discovers the prop cadaver being used is a murder victim; Booth gets a job offer; embarrassing information about Cam's past comes out.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a past suspect is back in court on appeal, Booth and Brennan work to prove he is guilty once and for all; Brennan becomes a suspect.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After Brennan is accused of murder, her father (Ryan O'Neal) helps her hide from the FBI; Booth and the team think an evil tech genius (Andrew Leeds) manipulated evidence to implicate Brennan.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A powerful divorce lawyer with a lot of enemies is murdered; the three-month separation between Booth and Brennan starts to take its toll.

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While investigating the death of an animal expo employee, the team is drawn into the world of animal trafficking; Brennan thinks she would be a good presidential candidate; Sweets and Daisy make a change.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and team rush to help when Matty's former mentor, Ian Cain, and his embassy staff come down with a deadly, mysterious illness; Taylor and Bozer work with Jerry Ortega to infiltrate a Codex cell.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When Mac and the team are unable to prevent sensitive intel from falling into Codex's hands, Mac must scale a vertical cliff using only gear he can cobble together himself to prevent the info's transmission.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: While on a mission to hunt down a Codex lead, Mac and the team discover Murdoc hacked their comms and has recorded them for months.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Riley head overseas together to prevent a governmental collapse and inadvertently inhale new, deadly microscopic technology.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac, Desi and Russ go under cover during a royal Indian wedding to protect a princess whose policies could put her life in danger; Bozer suspects Riley is up to her old hacking ways.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the team delve into the world of Italian car culture to track down a crime boss; Mac must lean on Desi when he discovers that he's losing the ability to control his hands; Mac and Desi move in together.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Desi travel with Bozer to his childhood home when his aunt dies in a tragic accident; they soon discover she may have been murdered for trying to expose the city's contaminated water supply.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Riley go missing and wake up 24 hours later in a cornfield with no memory of how they got there; they must unravel the mystery and find out how to get rid of the nanotrackers in their bodies, no matter the cost.

programme.desc: Junior and Tani track down the thief who robbed his parents' home; Five-0 investigates the murder of a beloved philanthropist and the theft of his valuable koa tree; Danny moves in with McGarrett.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Adam's girlfriend is kidnapped right in front of him, he shuts out Five-0 and breaks all the rules in order to get her back; the team investigates three seemingly unconnected homicides.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A tourist helicopter is shot down by a missile; a search for stolen artillery leads to a ghost from McGarrett's past -- Wo Fat; Adam makes a bold decision about his future with Five-0.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a list of undercover CIA agents is stolen, the team enlists the help of Magnum, Higgins, Rick and TC to get it back and protect national security; Higgins gives Tani some personal advice.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover and the team investigate a murder at a private golf course involving a man who was frozen to death in the locker room's cryotherapy chamber; McGarrett tags along with Danny when he tracks down the father of a boy who has been bullying Charlie.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Soon after Danny meets the girl of his dreams, they get into a potentially fatal car accident in an area far from help; McGarrett enlists Quinn and Tani to help when Eddie the dog suddenly shows signs of post-traumatic stress disorder.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Grover's niece goes missing from the police academy, it's discovered that her boyfriend is an undercover member of the yakuza.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Valentine's Day, Tani and Noelani are held hostage during a convenience store robbery; the team investigates the murder of a Thai diplomat whose wife confesses to the crime, but Danny suspects she's covering for the real killer.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Harry Langford helps Five-0 investigate some murders that follow the plot of a fabled, unpublished crime novel from the 1920s; Tani and Junior's friendship takes a meaningful new turn.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's Christmas and new detective Charlie Nelson moves into Midsomer. He's thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows. A man is fatally stabbed with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a "haunted" manor house. Can Barnaby and Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder and trap the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to restaurant Wyvern House and its tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron. Secrets from the past surface and the killer strikes again - but the poison spreads wider than its intended target.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is discovered in a reservoir dropped out of a plane, Barnaby and Nelson find the world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a tragic story from World War Two?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey. But excitement turns to fear when a man is found boiled to death in one of the vats. DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are puzzled; could this really be about beer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Mahesh Sidana - butterfly collector and founding member of an elite IQ society - is found murdered, pinned to a wall in a manner akin to his treasured butterfly specimens, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally. With the help of an old friend, can they catch the culprit before another victim is found...?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valley’s comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel. With a scathing comic shaming several villagers as the only lead, Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.
